str2: From the base of histemi; a standing, i.e. position; by implication, a popular uprising; figuratively, controversy.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To tear apart, burst. From dia and spao; to draw apart, i.e. Sever or dismember.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An army, detachment of troops. From strateuomai; an armament, i.e. a body of troops.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
To seize, snatch, obtain by robbery. From a derivative of haireomai; to seize.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of para and emballo; a throwing in beside, i.e., battle-array, encampment or barracks.
